WELCOME "APPOPAY User Terms of Service Agreement
Effective Date: December 31, 2023
1. GENERAL
1.1 These terms and conditions (hereinafter, the "Agreement", "Terms and Conditions", "T&C" or "Terms") govern the relationship between Stuffrs, S.A., (hereinafter, ‚ÄúStuffrs‚Äù, ‚ÄúUs‚Äù or ‚ÄúOur‚Äù) and the user of the appOpay Wallet and Platform, offered by Stuffrs. By downloading, registering and using the appOpay Wallet, you become an appOpay user, (hereinafter ‚ÄúUser‚Äù, ‚ÄúYou‚Äù or ‚ÄúYour‚Äù) and therefore you agree to comply fully with the contents of these terms and conditions.
1.1.1This Agreement constitute a legally binding contract between you whose name and other identification and contact information are entered in the corresponding fields for activation in the appOpay platform and Stuffrs. Stuffrs is a Fintech company organized and exists under the laws of the Republic of Panama, duly registered in the Public Registry of Panama on October 16, 2019, with Public Register number 28,781, together with the User, (the "Parties"). Stuffrs provides its products and services within the territory of Panama (the ‚ÄúTerritory‚Äù) under the trade name of appOpay.
1.2 Except where other special terms and conditions expressly apply, these Terms shall govern the rights and obligations of the parties with respect to the user‚Äôs use of the Wallet and the products and services (hereinafter ‚ÄúServices‚Äù) offered through it. The user agrees to read, understand and accept all terms set forth in this agreement and by checking the box next to accept Terms and Conditions, during the registration for an Account, you are certifying your acceptance of this Agreement. If you do not agree to our Terms, do not check the box next to accept Terms and Conditions and refrain from using the Wallet. These T&C shall be deemed accepted by both parties from the moment the user‚Äôs registration is approved by us.
1.3 We reserve the right to update, amend or modify (a Revised Version) all or part of these T&C at any time and at our sole discretion. A Revised Version may include additional or modified service-specific T&C in relation to current Products or Services. It is understood that the version published on the website www. appOpay.com is the current and updated version of these T&C. We will display the latest updated date, to reflect the date of any changes. If the modifications introduced in a revised terms and conditions increase your obligations, or limits your rights, we will inform you in advance of their entry into force, so that you can choose to continue using our services or discontinue the use of the services offered by appOpay.
1.3.1 It is your responsibility to consult the T&C from time-to-time and to take notice of any changes. It is important you review all revised versions as they become effective immediately and apply on an ongoing-forward basis, unless otherwise indicated.
1.3.2 Your continued use of the Wallet, following the posting of a revised version, constitutes your unconditional acceptance and agreement to the changes and you are deemed to have read, understood and unconditionally agree to abide, and be bound by such revised version.
1.3.3 Any Dispute (as defined in Section 34) that arose before a Revised Version will be governed by the Terms in place when the Dispute arose.
1.3.4 If at any time you no longer accept or agree with our Terms and Conditions or a revised version and do not wish to be bound by them, your sole and exclusive remedy is to stop using the Wallet and immediately withdrawal your Wallet Balance and delete the appOpay app.
1.4 By registering, accessing or using appOpay, you acknowledge, understand and accept that Electronic Mobile Wallets are not governed by regulations within the Republic of Panama. Therefore, you take full responsibility for any-and-all risk associated with the use of the Wallet and our services and hold Stuffrs, its officers, directors, employees and affiliated parties harmless from any-and-all loss or damages, except loss or damage from our gross negligence or willful misconduct.
1.4.1 AppOpay is not authorized to operate as a Bank or Financial Entity by the Superintendence of Banks of Panama. The funds placed in your Wallet Account is converted to electronic money and does not constitute a deposits, nor does it have any of the guarantees that a deposits may enjoy in accordance with the applicable legislation and regulations regarding deposits in Banks or Financial Entities.
1.4.2 You accept and acknowledge that our obligation is limited to providing the appOpay Wallet, Platform and related services, and does not imply any representation or guarantee in relation to the quality, security or legality of any service, between you and a third party.
1.5 Our obligations under these Terms and Conditions are solely conditional upon us accepting you as a user. Acceptance of a user is at our absolute and sole discretion, and a user may be rejected without specifying a reason. You agree to promptly, provide all information and/or documentation we request from you at any time, to enable us to comply with any legal requirements relating to your use of our Wallet, including but not limited to, information required by anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing regulation. You further consent to our verifying your information, by any means we deem appropriate, for these purposes.
1.6 You understand and agree that failure to provide any information or updated information requested, to meet regulatory requirements, will result in the termination of your use of the Wallet.
1.7 AppOpay is not responsible for any failure to perform or comply with any obligation(s), where applicable laws, acts, or omissions of a governmental or regulatory authority or agency prohibit or impedes us from performing such obligation(s) under this Agreement. This includes, but is not limited to, orders of domestic or foreign courts, tribunals, government restrictions, sanctions, restrictions on foreign exchange controls, etc.
1.8 You agree all communications between the Parties, including, without limitation, those providing for changes in the conditions set forth herein and any other applicable conditions regarding the Wallet and our Services shall be sent only through the App and/or to the email address indicated by you at the time of registration. You agree that we may contact you though the Wallet Chat service or through the email you provided.
1.8.1 You will be considered to have received a communication from us 24 hours after the time we send it.
18.2 You understand and agree that, to the extent permitted by law, we may, without further notice or warning, monitor and/or maintain a copy of chat conversations and emails you or anyone acting on your behalf has with us for quality control and training purposes or for our own protection. You acknowledge and understand that while your communications with us may be monitored or copied it does not guarantee that every chat or email will be retained or retrievable.
1.9 We do not provide investment or financial advice or consulting services. We are solely the provider of appOpay and do not advise or make recommendations about engaging in electronic transactions or operations. Decisions on making electronic transactions or preform operations involving digital transactions is taken on your own accord and at your own risk.
1.10 For the avoidance of doubt, this Agreement takes precedence over any other arrangement between you and us concerning appOpay.
2. DEFINITIONS
For the purposes of this Agreement, the following words shall have the meanings set forth below, whether used in the singular or plural, capitalized or lowercase, as appropriate in relation to the text in which they appear:
"Account Balance" or "Balance" ‚Äì means the Electronic Money held in a Wallet Account, less any Fees or Funds on hold, which belongs to the account owner and available to conduct transactions through the Wallet. "Activation" ‚Äì means the point in time when the Wallet ID and Account is activated by us. "Additional Terms and Conditions" ‚Äì means the Terms and Conditions of future Products and/or Services and/or Terms and Conditions based upon country specific regulations. "Agent" ‚Äì means any entity authorized by Stuffrs to carry out, on its own account and order, the operations of converting cash into electronic money, as well as reconverting electronic money into cash or providing a service. "Agreement" ‚Äì means this User Terms of Service Agreement. "Application" or "App"‚Äì means the mobile wallet software program developed by Stuffrs for use on smartphones and where you as a user will interact with appOpay in relation to the services. "AppOpay" ‚Äì means the commercial name used for the digital wallet offered by Stuffrs. "AppOpay Card or Wallet Card" ‚Äì means a virtual or physical prepaid or debit card, associated to the Wallet. "AppOpay Platform" ‚Äì means our websites, app, systems (including any networks and servers used to provide any of our services) operated by us or on our behalf, and any of our services that facilitates a large scalable networks of interdependent users and resources that can be accessed on demand to produce and exchange value among and between the network users. "AppOpay Wallet" or "Wallet" ‚Äì means the provision of mobile financial services conjointly, the appOpay Products, including its Platform and Services, (both currently or future), the Wallet ID, Wallet Account, Wallet Card and Wallet Balance accessed through the App. "Business Day(s)" ‚Äì means Monday through Friday, excluding holidays when appOpay‚Äôs offices are not considered open for business in Panama. Holidays are those days designated as Official National Holidays. "Cash" ‚Äì means Money in the physical form, such as banknotes and coins, also referred to as Physical Currency and/or Funds herein. "Chat Account" or "Chat" ‚Äì means an account established by appOpay that enables a user to talk to other appOpay users through the application. "Electronic Money" ‚Äì means money that exists in computer systems that may be used to facilitate electronic transactions and is backed by physical currency. "Eligible Devise" ‚Äì means a mobile phone with either an iOS or Android operating platform with a version of operating software that supports the use of the Wallet and has a camera function. "Fees" ‚Äì means monies owed to us by a user for Services provided through the Wallet. "Funds" ‚Äì means money denominated in sovereign currency of Panama and readily available for a particular purpose, but not cryptocurrency or any other form of asset not readily available. "IMEI" or "International Mobile Equipment Identity" ‚Äì means a unique 15-digit serial number given to every mobile phone by the manufacturer. "Merchant" ‚Äì means any legal entity or person licensed, if necessary, by regulatory authority of the jurisdiction(s) in which it operates and authorized by appOpay to accept appOpay as a means of payment for the products and/or services it sells. "Mobile Wallet" ‚Äì means either a built-in feature or an app that can be installed onto smartphones. It stores electronic money and other items uploaded to it, including but not limited to, payment cards, financial accounts, identifiers (such as phone numbers or tokens) linked to a bank account, QR Codes, Account Balances and other kinds of payment methods that can be used to manage and conduct transactions with Electronic Money stored on them. "Money" ‚Äì means a commodity accepted by general consent as a medium of economic exchange. "Our" ‚Äì means Stuffrs S.A., its strategic alliances, affiliates, and associates. "Password" ‚Äì means a unique sequence of numbers the user creates upon successful registration that will be required each time the user connects to the Wallet platform. The Password is personal and non-transferable. "Physical Currency" ‚Äì means the tangible form of money that is paper bills and coins. "Personal Identification Number" or "PIN" ‚Äì means a number created by the user during the registration process that must be entered to validate an electronic transaction. No electronic money can be transferred from a user account until the user PIN has been entered, regardless of transaction type. A PIN is personal and non-transferable. "Politically Exposed Persons" or "PEP" ‚Äì means those national or foreign persons who fulfill prominent high-level public functions or with command and jurisdiction in a state, such as (but not limited to) heads of state or government, high-profile politicians, government officials, high-level ranking judicial or military personnel, senior executives of state companies or corporations, public officials who hold elected positions, among others who make decisions in public entities; persons who perform or have been entrusted with important functions by an international organization, such as members of senior management, that is, directors, deputy directors and members of the board of directors or equivalent officials. "Revised Version" ‚Äìmeans any addition, subtraction or change of an existing Term and Condition. "Services" ‚Äì means any Product or Service offered by Stuffrs through the App. "Stuffrs S.A." ‚Äì means a Panamanian Company with public deed number 28,781. "Transaction Pin" ‚Äì means a six-digit number the user creates upon registering with the Wallet that the User must entered in every financial operation that the user carries out with the Wallet. The use of the transaction pin replaces the user's signature for all legal purposes. The pin is personal and non-transferable. "Unauthorized Transaction" ‚Äì means when money is sent from your Wallet Account that you did not authorize and that did not benefit you. "Us" ‚Äì means Stuffrs S.A., its strategic alliances, affiliates, and associates. "User" ‚Äì means any natural person who downloads and registers the appOpay App in their name and whose registration has been accepted by us. "Virtual Account", "Wallet Account" or "Account" ‚Äì means a unique and unrepeatable electronic monetary record in the appOpay database, that enables users to carry out transactions with electronic money and is established upon the issuance of a wallet id, and which the user is the sole owner. "Wallet Identification Number", "Wallet ID" or "ID" ‚Äì means a unique identification number issued by appOpay to differentiate users. "We" ‚Äì means Stuffrs S.A., its strategic alliances, affiliates, and associates. "You" or "Your" ‚Äì means a current or prospective user of appOpay. 3. APPOPAY PLATFORM
3.1 The appOpay platform provides the functionality necessary to deliver a trustworthy and secure environment for the deployment of our Services, for your benefit as you participate in chat and the appOpay Wallet ecosystem.
3.2 The platform facilitates the provisioning and activation of appOpay mobile financial services, which enables you to interact, make transfers and make payments through electronic means.
3.2.1 Converts cash into electronic money and enables electronic money to be converted into cash.
3.2.2 The sending/withdrawal of electronic money to and from the Wallet.
3.2.3 The transferring and payments between users.
3.2.4 The purchase of good and services with the Account Balance.
3.2.5 The purchase of airtime recharge
3.2.6 Provides an electronic monetary records database reflecting user‚Äôs electronic accounts, balances and transactional history that enables users to carry out transactions with their electronic balance.
3.2.7 Any other service that is made available through the Wallet.
4. MOBILE WALLET DESCRIPTION
4.1 AppOpay records electronic money on its platform, the provisioning of mobile financial services and enables all legally permitted uses of electronic money, such as electronic payments and transfers, via Eligible Devices. AppOpay facilitates electronic transactions including but not limited to: contactless NFC and QR Code payments between users and merchants, the sending and receiving of electronic money through online and offline transactions and the transformation of cash to electronic money and cash to electronic money.
4.2 Electronic money has the following characteristics:
4.2.1 Its value is equivalent to the value of physical currency credited.
4.2.2 It is accepted as a means of payment in the businesses accepting payments in electronic form.
4.2.3 It is convertible to cash at any time through enabled channels; and
4.2.4 When converted to cash it will be redeemed in the legal tender of Panama.
4.3 The Wallet saves and stores information upload to it, including but not limited to, virtual/credit/debit/prepaid cards and other payment methods, Wallet ID (such as your phone number, pins or tokens) linked to an account. Gift and loyalty cards, coupons, points and other items.
4.3.1 The Wallet also saves and stores information surrounding service transactions conducted through it, such as purchases, payments, loading methods, chat history, and other information."
"5. WALLET PRODUCTS AND SERVICES
5.1. AppOpay‚Äôs Platform, with the participation of third party providers of complementary services such as, but not limited to, payment processors, credit card networks and providers of automated data processing services, enables users to manage and use our services, including but not limited to:
(1) ‚ÄúChat‚Äù, communications between users and between users and us;
(2) ‚ÄúP-2-P Transfer‚Äù, the sending of electronic money to family and friends that have an AppOpay Account, for - noncommercial purposes;
(3) ‚ÄúBill Payment‚Äù, paying bills, electronically through the platform without physically visiting a Biller location;
(4) ‚ÄúTop-up Airtime‚Äù, adding minutes to a devise that utilizes mobile minutes;
(5) ‚ÄúShopping‚Äù, purchasing products, information, goods, services or materials online or in stores with your Wallet or other payment methods tied to your Wallet;
(6) ‚ÄúQR Code Payment‚Äù, paying for purchases contactless by using our integrated Global NFC QR Code payment feature at participating merchants around the world; and,
(7) ‚ÄúCash-Out‚Äù, converting electronic money into physical cash at businesses displaying the AppOpay Agent Logo, (‚ÄúAgent Locations‚Äù).

23. HOLDS, LIMITATIONS, AND RESERVES
23.1 Under certain circumstances, in order to protect us and the security and integrity of our Wallet and Platform, we may take account-level or transaction-level actions. Unless otherwise noted, if we take any of the actions described here, we will provide you with notice of our actions, but we retain the sole discretion to take these actions. To request information in connection with an account limitation, hold or reserve, you should contact appOpay support though the Wallet chat feature, or follow the instructions in our notice with respect to the limitation, hold or reserve. Account holds or limitations may affect your ability to move electronic money to or from your Wallet Account.
23.1.1 To protect us and other users from loss, we may delay a transaction, transfer or withdrawal, in certain situations, including if we need to confirm that you have authorized the transaction, transfer or withdrawal. If we place a limitation on your Wallet Account, a payment or transaction is subject to a hold, or your account has a negative balance while a withdrawal from your Account is pending, you will have to reinitiate the withdrawal once the limitation or hold has been lifted, or negative balance is fully paid off.
23.1.2 Our decision about holds, limitations and reserves may be based on confidential criteria that are essential to our management of risk and the protection of appOpay, our customers and/or service providers. We may use proprietary fraud and risk modeling when assessing the risk associated with your Wallet Account. In addition, we may be restricted by regulation or a governmental authority from disclosing certain information to you about such decisions. You agree that we have no obligation to disclose the details of our risk management or security procedures to you.
23.1.3 In order to facilitate actions described above and allow us to assess the level of risk associated with your Wallet Account, you agree to cooperate with all reasonable requests for financial statements and other documentation or information in a timely fashion.
23.2 A hold or limitation is an action that we may take under certain circumstances at either the transaction level or the account level. When appOpay places a temporary hold or limitation on a transaction, the money is not available to either the sender or the recipient. We review many factors before placing a hold or limitation on a transaction, including but not limited to: account tenure, transaction activity, transaction type, and past disputes.
23.3 There are several reasons why your Account could be placed on hold or limited, including but not limited to.
23.3.1 If we suspect someone could be using your Wallet Account without your knowledge, we will limit it for your protection and look into the fraudulent activity.
23.3.2 If your debit or credit card issuer alerts us of someone has used your card without your permission. Similarly, if your bank lets us know that there have been unauthorized transfers between your Wallet Account and your bank account.
23.3.3 In order to comply with applicable law.
23.3.4 If we believe in our sole discretion that you have breached this agreement.
23.4 Unless a permanent limitation or hold is placed on your account, you will need to resolve any issues with your account before a limitation or hold can be removed. Normally, this is done after you provide us with the information we request. However, if we reasonably believe a risk still exists after you have provided us that information, we may take action to protect appOpay, you, other users, or third parties from reversals, fees, fines, penalties, legal and/or regulatory risks and any other liability.
23.5 If we place a reserve on your Account Balance, the Balance will be shown as "pending" and we will notify you of the terms of the reserve. If we change the terms of the reserve due to a change in our risk assessment, we will notify you of the new terms.
24. ERROR RESOLUTION
24.1 An ‚ÄúError‚Äù means the following:
24.1.1 When electronic money is either incorrectly taken from your Account Balance or incorrectly placed into your Wallet Account, or when a transaction is incorrectly recorded in your Wallet Account.
24.1.2 You conduct a transaction and the incorrect amount is debited from your Account Balance.
24.1.3 An incorrect amount is credited to your Account Balance.
24.1.4 A transaction is missing from or not properly identified in your transaction summary.
24.1.5We make a computational or mathematical error related to your Account.
24.2 The following are NOT considered Errors:
24.2.1 Giving a third-party access to your Wallet Account (by providing them your credentials) and they use your Account without your knowledge or permission. You are responsible for transactions made in this situation.
24.2.2 Routine inquiries about the balance in your Account.
24.2.3 Requests for duplicate documentation or other information for tax or other recordkeeping purposes.
24.3 If you find an error or have a question about an electronic transfer, contact us at customer support through the chat feature of the Wallet.
24.3.1 Notify us as soon as possible, if you believe your transaction summary or receipt is incorrect or if you need more information about a transfer listed on the transaction summary or receipt. We must hear from you no later than 60 days after we provide the FIRST transaction summary on which the problem or error appeared.
24.3.1.1 Provide your name and account number.
24.3.1.2 Tell us the dollar amount of the suspected error.
24.3.1.3 Describe the error or the transfer you are unsure about, and explain as clearly as you can why you believe it is an error or why you need more information.
24.3.2 We will determine whether an error occurred within 10 business days after you contact us and will correct any error promptly. If we need more time, however, we may take up to 45 days to investigate your complaint or question. If we decide to do this, we will credit your Account within 10 business days for the amount you think is in error, so that you will have the use of the money during the time it takes us to complete our investigation.
24.3.2.1 Should we determine no error occurred, you hereby irrevocably agree we have the right to withdrawal the credit from your Account.
24.3.2.2 We may ask you to provide more details concerning your complaint or question in writing. If we do not receive your response within 10 business days, we may not credit your Account Balance.
24.3.3 For errors involving new Wallet Accounts, point-of-sale transactions, or foreign-initiated transactions, we may take up to 90 days to investigate your complaint or question. For new Wallet Accounts, we may take up to 20 business days to credit your Account for the amount you think is in error.
24.3.4 We will tell you the results within 3 business days after completing our investigation. If we decide that there was no error, we will send you a written explanation. You may ask for copies of the documents that we used in our investigation.
25. PROCESSING ERRORS
25.1 We will rectify any processing error that we discover. If the error results in:
25.1.1 You receiving less than the correct amount to which you were entitled, then we will credit your Wallet Account for the difference between what you should have received and what you actually received.
25.1.2 You receiving more than the correct amount to which you were entitled, then we will debit your Wallet Account for the difference between what you actually received and what you should have received.
25.1.3 We do not completing a transaction on time or in the correct amount, then we will be responsible to you for your losses or damages directly caused by this failure, unless:
25.1.3.1 Through no fault of ours, you did not have enough available electronic money to complete the transaction.
25.1.3.2 Our Platform was not working properly and you knew about the breakdown when you started the transaction; or
25.1.3.3 The error was due to extraordinary circumstances outside our control (such as fire, flood or loss of Internet connection), despite our reasonable precautions.
25.2 Processing errors are not:
25.2.1 Delays that result from us applying holds, limitations or reserves.
25.2.2 Delays based on a payment review.
25.2.3 Delays related to the time it may take for a purchase transaction to be completed in some situations.
25.2.4 Errors made by you in making a transaction (for example, mistyping an amount of money that you are sending)."
